article:
Events and trends
* EgyptâEnd of Fourteenth Dynasty.
* The creation of one of the oldest surviving astronomical documents, a copy of
  which was found in the Babylonian library of Ashurbanipal: a 21-year record of
  the appearances of Venus (which the early Babylonians called Nindaranna).
* The end of the Indus Valley civilization.
* The overthrow of the ruling Amorite dynasty in Aleppo, Syria.
* The date of the earliest discovered rubber balls.
* Egypt conquered by Asian tribes known as the Hyksosâsee History of ancient
  Israel and Judah.
* 1600 BCâShang Dynasty instituted in China.
* 1600 BCâTumulus culture started.
* c. 1600 BCâNebra skydisk created in what is now modern day Germany.
* c. 1600 BCâThe foundations of the Olmec civilization in Southern Mexico.
* c. 1600 BCâCycladic civilization ends.
* c. 1600 BCâ1550 BCâ"Mask of Agamemnon" Funerary mask, from the royal tombs at
  Mycenae, Greece, is made. Grave Circle A. It is now at National Archaeological
  Museum of Athens.
* c. 1600 BCâ1200 BCâHittite (Anatolia) iron tools and weapons.
* c. 1600 BC â 1200 BCâTiryns, Ancient Greece, is inhabited.
* c. 1600 BC â Kings and princes on the mainland Greece have begun building
  large aboveground burial places commonly referred to as beehive tombs because
  of their rounded, conical shape.
* c. 1600 BCâHittites establish capital at Hattushash (near modern
  Boghazkeui, Turkey).

Significant people
* 1602 BCâDeath of Shem, son of Noah, according to the Hebrew Calendar
